Reference was made in the opening paragraph to an article setting out recommendations for a statistical engineering syllabus to be included in the engineering curriculum. This embraces both the managerial and the statistical aspects of quality
Statistical Engineering – the Key to Quality
Evidence of the importance of including a statistical element in the academic engineering curriculum is provided in a more recent article
The missing link

title: Statistical quality control (SQC) using control charts and other statistical methods originated in the first half of the twentieth century with the pioneering work of Walter Shewhart and his colleagues in America. In recent times there has been a revival of interest under the guise of statistical process control (SPC). Useful references for the content of this chapter are listed below
